Header: Morales vows to beat charges of terrorism and sedition
Content: Appearing with two high-profile constitutional and defense lawyers, former Bolivian President Evo Morales vowed to beat charges of sedition and terrorism, weeks after the interim government of Jeanine Anez issued an arrest warrant for him. Sitting by his side in the Buenos Aires hotel were former Argentine Supreme Court Judge Raul Zaffaroni, a specialist in constitutional law and a judge on the Inter-American Court of Human Rights, and constitutional lawyer Gustavo Ferreyra. Both attorneys told journalists they were willing to form part of Moralesâ€™ defense team.
